messages.content: ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes is used for scoring images in a batch to determine which images best fit a given prompt, using the PickScore model.
To install ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes, ensure your ComfyUI is up to date and then clone the repository using the following git command: `git clone https://github.com/Zuellni/ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes`.
What are the different nodes available in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
The nodes available in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes are Loader, Processor, and Selector.
Can you provide a brief description of each node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?

The Loader node is used to load scoring models from Hugging Face or a given directory. The Processor node takes images/text and converts them to inputs for the Selector node. The Selector node selects up to `limit` best images and passes them to other nodes along with latents/masks of the same shape. If the `threshold` isn't reached, it interrupts processing.
Can I view an example workflow for ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
Yes, there is an image available in the repository that can be opened in ComfyUI to view an example workflow.
